title: Senior Customer Experience Manager
content:
Aimé Leon Dore is looking for a Customer Experience Manager to join our team in Queens, New York, reporting directly to the Chief Customer Officer. This position is responsible for the implementation and execution of brand-enhancing customer service initiatives, while developing and leading a team of service professionals to achieve departmental goals. Through oversight of ALD’s customer support strategy and execution, this position will serve as the brand champion in a community-focused environment that increases brand loyalty while driving efficiency through a broad set of operational touchpoints for consumers and customers. Their efforts will be key to providing frontline excellence at all touchpoints in a seamless manner to ensure the highest level of consumer satisfaction.
 
Duties and Responsibilities
Experience Strategy & Execution

Deliver best-in-class communication and experience, ensuring best-in-class customer outreach is consistent across all channels and audiences are provided with appropriate and informative information in a timely manner
Own, update and improve the SOPs and processes for the customer experience teams; develop policies, procedures and operating budgets in concert with the customer engagement vision and strategy
Support the CCO in establishing strategic direction and determining the model for overall brand support in key markets and new extensions of the ALD community
Oversee customer experience team and be the point of escalation for all channels (remote agents, end customers, internal teams, and vendors)
Monitor operational dashboards, analyze and report on performance of key partners and vendors
Execute strategic business plans, operational goals and performance metrics that drive productivity and ensure the highest level of consumer, customer, and associate satisfaction
Oversee fraud, chargeback, and otherwise risk-indicating behavior mitigation processes
Work with retail teams to ensure communication content & style is consistent and on-brand

 
Leadership & Team Development

Lead and manage the support function of Customer Experience; cultivate and lead a high-performing, consumer-oriented team
Provide strategic leadership to the Customer Experience team, broadening and elevating their abilities
Develop and build a high-performing team while providing mentoring and career opportunities to continuously build their capabilities. Ensure leadership and training results in delivery of a high-level service and associate satisfaction. Ensure staff meet and/or exceed KPIs
Monitor, listen and respond to customer inquiries while maintaining the appropriate tone of voice across all touchpoints
Provide strong, dynamic leadership that mentors, develops, and guides team members to efficiently leverage the value of every interaction for maximum customer satisfaction and operational effectiveness
Continuously review, balance and scale team resources to support the growth & demands of our customer base

 
Reporting & Oversight

Execute reporting on customer queries, including ideas to address key issues and reduce ticket volume
Utilize & compile data and insights on performance and report to ALD leadership team
Define and implement escalation processes for customer inquiries 
Bring thought leadership to develop consumer and customer experience metrics aligned with ALD’s corporate strategy and goals
Manage and improve consumer and customer experience metrics including contact volume, contact patterns and resolution outcomes to ensure service level objectives are met
Responsible for tracking, analyzing, and recommending improvements to the customer journey as it relates to digital features, policy changes, or procedure updates
Partner with stakeholders across the business on product releases, digital campaigns, launches, promotions, updates and troubleshooting
Track competitive behavior, policies, platforms, and consumer expectation to understand and prioritize business opportunities
Collaborate with Data & Insights team to understand behavior trends, implement new reports, and analyze performance to increase efficiency & identify areas of improvement

 
Qualifications

5-7 years experience in customer-facing role; Retail industry preferred.
People management experience
Ability to thrive in situations of ambiguity
Excels in a high-volume, rapidly changing environment, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal
Must be organized and illustrate keen attention to detail 
Proven ability to execute exceptional customer service standards across support channels

Salary Range: $70,000 - $80,000 Created in 2014, Aimé Leon Dore is a lifestyle, sport and ready-to-wear brand based out of Queens, New York. With a strong focus on simple yet powerful design, we are driven to create timeless work by portraying an aesthetic that is uniquely our own
